description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1p798","text":"This protocol describes how to dissect a rat to collect various tissue from an animal. Collected tissue is intended to be used for phenotypic characterization of various traits. Tissues also can be used for DNA extraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3f6su","text":"Setting up ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8rti","text":"Animals are fasted ~    ( ), water should be provided.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":22,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d56l8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":50400,"guid":"105E7D80AF8211EC9878C9A3EF746715","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":57600,"guid":"1697D020AF8211EC9878C9A3EF746715","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":57600,"guid":"EF3A7370AF8111EC9878C9A3EF746715","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bokhm","text":".Prepare labelsfor tissue collection tubes/vials. All nesessary files are in “Barcoding package” folder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":1,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6akil","text":"Take the rats which are going to be processed this day and scan their RFIDs to prepare the file for tissue collection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ej2kg","text":"Read the RFIDs into RFID worksheet (the yellow area) of the barcodes-text-ratGWAS.xlsx. (No inputting of a #-sign or ‘ necessary, the sheet is formatted as text and will automatically interpret everything as text). The program will enter five identical barcodes to the each row on the next sheet named “Barcodes for printing”. Five identical barcodes are printed in each row.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":20,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":60,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vh74","text":"Print labels with barcode and RFID number using the Barcodes for printing worksheet and the Printing Cryo Babies.docx instructions. Print each sheet 6 times to get the 30 identical barcoded labels you need. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":92,"length":25},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":164,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ev0ql","text":"Label freezer boxes (2”, 3”, or 5” high) with the Center (MI, TN, NY), type of tissue, the box number, and the date (e.g.TN-Batch 08 Feb-17).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rf69","text":"Prepare containers for tissue collection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"850mj","text":"Prepare abucket with dry ice with a glass beaker filled with isopenten for flash-freezing tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":8},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":9,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4vdr1","text":"Have a computer ready for data entry. Create a new file for each batch using a template RatSampleCollection_BatchNN_MI_DDMonYYYY_Template_v3, e.g. RatSampleCollection_Batch02_MI_04Jun2015.xlsx, for data entry. When collecting tissues from a rat, read the rat’s RFID again (keep cursor on the yellow cell B2 on the worksheet “Check numbers”). Then read the barcodes on the tubes to check whether they are readable and match (cursor position B3, B4...), the program gives a warning if the numbers don’t match.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":88,"length":54},{"style":"bold","offset":146,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5nuc6","text":"Glucose Measurement","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e0pm1","text":"Put a test strip in the glucose meter (man by Contour NEXT)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0em3","text":"Test the meter using the control solution; make sure the reading is within the range (ranges listed on the bottom of the strip box).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ecgdu","text":"Put a test strip in the glucose meter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4tp9i","text":"Restrain the rat. Cut off ~1mm of the tip of the rat’s tail. Gently milk/stroke the rat’s tail from the base near the butt to the tip of the tail. Discard the first drop of blood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7aect","text":"Place a drop of blood on the glucose strip. Record the reading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1577f","text":"Note: if glucose measurement is collected at a different time than sacrifice, create a new row in the RatSampleCollection...xlsx spreadsheet, record the data into columns A through H, and copy “NA” into every other cell of that row.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":232},{"style":"bold","offset":102,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cpc62","text":"Take the weight in grams, at a 0.1 g precision. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fp6ek","text":"Fecal pellet collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7c36r","text":"Place animal securely on the researcher’s arm. Assess if there are pellets in the rectum by gently feeling the rectal canal (externally, gently pinch the anus between index finger and thumb and massage gently back 1-2cm from the anus). If pellets are present, they will feel like small solid masses (1cm in length). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cu0se","text":"The pellet is gently pushed towards the anus, and immediately placed in the sterile tube, by holding the tube in position immediate to the anus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9gn3j","text":"The pellets are snap frozen on dry ice and stored at for later processing. This procedure should be performed as rapidly as possible to ensure integrity of the microbiota.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":52,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"21ckn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8AF16D50AF8211EC9878C9A3EF746715","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a8eld","text":"If pellets are not present, repeat pellet extraction in a few minutes. If still no pellet, do not collect it and proceed to anesthesia.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1m9eh","text":"Isoflurane Anesthesia ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"74j80","text":"Turn oxygen on to about 1L / minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ar5o","text":"Place rat in induction chamber that has oxygen and isoflurane lines attached to it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6po2v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9c42h","text":"Turn on the isoflurane at about 5%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4nbgo","text":"Wait a few minutes until the rat is lying down and eyes are slightly shut. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1rgr","text":"Take cover off container and pinch the toes to ensure surgical plane of anesthesia.If rat reacts, put it back in the chamber for a little bit longer.If no reaction, take the rat out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6e2ko","text":"Length","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e39ha","text":"tape the ruler to the table so it doesn’t move around.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kl03","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4f9r","text":"Head to butt","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek6t9","text":"-Measure in cm the length from tip of the nose to the end of the butt (0.1cm precision).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"535o6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8t62o","text":"Head to tail","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgimp","text":"-Measure in cm the length from tip of the nose to the end of the tail. (0.1 cm precision)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1n584","text":"Blood Collection via Cardiac Puncture ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e8625","text":"Cutting open ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4l84i","text":"Place the rat on its back on the table.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"alfl7","text":"Place the isoflurane nose cone on the rat ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4sm1f","text":"Spray fur with   EtOH ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ugnk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"70","error_concentration":false,"guid":"3FFBF470D54111ECB263E58F7FD32AF3","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4j294","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2arqd","text":"Using a forceps, grab a section of skin right above the abdominal cavity, and pull itup towards you while making a “Y” incision in the rat. Remove extra skin to expose the peritoneal cavity","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"452t0","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9s62r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"776AEB70D0D511ECBD5B39F138016D0D","height":166.9090909090909,"id":241994,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-10 at 7.52.51 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnknbqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkkbqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkmbqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkjbqymf.webp","width":355.81395348837214}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4kmie","text":"Blood Collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"50p3f","text":"Open up a new needle and   syringe. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2r4id","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"4791C9D0D54111ECB263E58F7FD32AF3","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"be3h6","text":"Holding sternum with forceps,cut through the diaphragm with scissors. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dfhbi","text":"Insert the needle into the tip of the heart and draw up blood. Move the needle around to find a good position. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1ghg3","text":"Inject blood into the serum separation tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"euffk","text":"Keep collecting until collect ~5mlCap the blood tube, invert 5 times, and place on ice until centrifugation.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":108,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2th94","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"77395EB0D0D611ECAF9045306772883B","height":247,"id":241998,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-10 at 8.00.01 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnksbqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkqbqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkrbqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkpbqymf.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8563a","text":"Trunk Blood Collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h823","text":"Uncap a serum separation tube, put it on wet ice, and insert a funnel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"di613","text":"Put rat into holder and into guillotine, decapitate animal over funnel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ccfnc","text":"Hold animal over funnel, head side down. Collect all trunk blood coming out of the animal","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ge4c","text":"Take out funnel and recap tube. Invert tube 5 times and put back on ice until tissue harvest is done. -","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hk9e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8h8vq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"36ol7","text":"Brain","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epcjc","text":"Cut off the head and hand over to the second person to perform a brain dissection. Record the time at the start of brain dissection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5oe2","text":"If only one person is collecting the tissues and the brain, put the head on ice and dissect the brain after theliver tissue is frozen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":108},{"style":"italic","offset":111,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bhh4o","text":"Open the skull and remove the whole brain. Submerge it in the bucket of isopenten coooled in the container with dry ice (~ ). When tissue is completely frozen (~ ), gently wrap it in aluminum foil and transfer into the ½ oz jar and keep on dry ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":122,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":161,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a61fi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"14583B80D54111ECB263E58F7FD32AF3","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-30","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"1A7BBC30D54111ECB263E58F7FD32AF3","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"739tt","text":"Liver","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b45v7","text":"Grab the top left liver lobe (left median lobe) with the forceps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q72t","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6f78o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"ABDBC4E0D54111ECB263E58F7FD32AF3","height":214,"id":242002,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"old guts png NEW.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkwbqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkubqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkvbqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnktbqymf.webp","width":289}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4f4h","text":"Pull the lobe up and cut it out being careful not to cut the large vein/artery that runs towards the back. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"arhfm","text":"Place a labeled ½ oz. jar on the scale and tare. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8qho0","text":"Place the liver lobe in the jar.Weigh (to 1mg), record the weight, cap the container and place it on dry ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0qrt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1asdm","text":"Likewise, excise the right median liver lobe. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"von4","text":"Place a labeled ½ oz. jar on the scale and tare; Place liver lobe into vial, weigh (to 1mg), record weight, and place jar on dry ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2vnjk","text":"Retroperitoneal Fat","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9ddnl","text":"Move intestines/organs out of the way and locate the left kidney. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"auadu","text":"Grab the kidney with your finger and pull away the fat that is attached to it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ciau0","text":"Once kidney is disconnected, let go of the kidney and continue cutting/removing the fat from the cavity. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f71l","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e66pe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0DC393F0D0D711ECAF9045306772883B","height":382,"id":242006,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-10 at 8.04.14 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnk2bqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkybqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkzbqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnkxbqymf.webp","width":438}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4jgpp","text":"As you move closer to the testicles, you will see a faint “line” of fat.This is a landmark to determine where the fat pad ends.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c5rc2","text":"Cut along that line and remove the fat out of the rat  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2d5gq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i9dl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"420C6F60D0D711ECAF9045306772883B","height":223,"id":242010,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-10 at 8.05.42 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnk6bqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnk4bqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnk5bqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnk3bqymf.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dio96","text":"Place a labeled 1/2oz. jar on the scale and tare; ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3u6kl","text":"-dd the fat to the jar ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ftui9","text":"Move the intestine/organs out of the way and locate the right kidney.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e545","text":"Repeat the procedure above and remove the peritoneal fat on the right side.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82t7k","text":"Place the right side fat in the same container that contains the left side fat, weigh in grams (to 1 mg). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"68k49","text":"Record the weight, cap the container and place it in dry ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fk01","text":"Pull both testicles out of the body cavity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4c124","text":"Repeat the above steps for the right parametral fat.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"193vp","text":"Move intestines/organs to locate the left kidney.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nlv6","text":"Remove the cover of the container, add the kidney to the container, cap the container, weigh it, and record the weight in grams.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cssv","text":"Dissect out the right kidney the same way the left kidney was dissected out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ifnu","text":"Place a covered and labeled container with 10% ZBF Zinc formalin on the scale and tare (containes come pre-filled).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nlv6","text":"Remove the cover of the container, add the kidney to the container, cap the container, weigh it, and record the weight in grams.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a659a","text":"Cecum","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"da253","text":"Identify cecum in abdominal cavity. The cecum is found where the small and large intestines meet. It appears as a “dead end” structure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1klun","text":"Remove cecum by cutting immediately at the entrance of the small intestine to caecum and immediately below the exit of the caecum to large intestine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"beag","text":"Place isolated caecum and its contents into a sterile collection 50 ml tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78pqf","text":"Grab the rat’s right foot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8rjns","text":"Carefully cut a circle around the ankle being extra careful to only cut the skin and not any tendons underneath, using scissors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ldrk","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6bgh0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ar7rg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sl96","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D0801110D0D811ECAF9045306772883B","height":192,"id":242038,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-10 at 8.16.51 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnm2bqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnmybqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnmzbqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnmxbqymf.webp","width":256}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fnu7","text":"Remove the skin of the leg by grabbing a piece of the skin near the circle you just cut with forceps and pulling up towards the knee.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6no4v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bcda","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"adluk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F26C7430D0D811ECAF9045306772883B","height":167.24363636363628,"id":242042,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-10 at 8.17.46 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnm6bqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnm4bqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnm5bqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnm3bqymf.webp","width":442.23076923076906}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1mdh3","text":"Take a thin tipped forceps and poke a hole in the space between the Achilles tendon and connecting tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fn1vu","text":"Look at the rat’s lower leg; you’ll see a white line running the length of the gastrocnemius muscle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3tvvn","text":"Place thin tipped forceps in the hole you just made by the Achilles tendon, and remove the outer covering of the gastrocnemius by pulling up along the white line.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":162,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c41l5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8boe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"19350AF0D0D911ECAF9045306772883B","height":189.23818181818194,"id":242046,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-10 at 8.18.51 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnnabqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnm8bqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnm9bqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnm7bqymf.webp","width":479.635944700461}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"qeek","text":"Directly below that white line is the soleus. It appears as a brighter red color than the gastrocnemius and has tendons that attach to the area of the Achilles tendon and to the knee. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7lij","text":" Use the thin tipped forceps and pull forward the soleus by using the forceps as a spoon","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7di7","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7f2eb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c061i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3614B490D0D911ECAF9045306772883B","height":193.24999999999997,"id":242050,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-10 at 8.19.41 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnnebqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnncbqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnndbqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnnbbqymf.webp","width":257.6666666666667}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4v8m","text":"Find the end of the soleus tendon that attaches near the Achilles tendon. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fv6l9","text":"Place a hemostat on the tendon. Make sure it’s on the tendon and not the muscle! ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5jkpa","text":" Using small scissors, cut the tendon to release the muscle from the leg.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k8mn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bugoa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ailr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6EAFFA30D0D911ECAF9045306772883B","height":192.05454545454552,"id":242054,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-05-10 at 8.21.15 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnnibqymf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnngbqymf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnnhbqymf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hnnfbqymf.webp","width":467.3893805309737}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fbaui","text":"-Put rat in the prone position, head facing away from you, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fb7b9","text":"Retract left leg (left leg works better for the right handed person) away from the body and approach with the scissors from the back of the thigh. Cut through the skin and soft tissues (muscle) as close to the body as possible. Aim to locate the femur, but don’t cut it. Instead, move the tip of the scissors along the femur in the direction of the hip joint ). You will be able to find the capsule of the hip joint if you go ~1/8 of an inch from the proximal tip of the shaft of the femur towards the tail (if you think of your forearm as a shaft of the femur, the neck of the femur sticks out as a thumb of your left hand when its palm faces down). It will be easier to spot the joint if you keep moving that hip with your left hand. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3sn4","text":"Cut through the capsule of the joint with the tips of the scissors and that will release the head of the femur. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6alud","text":"Cut through the soft tissues and the skin in the front of the thigh. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
